snippet: Ribera’s portraits, hidden up high and in the darkness of a church in Naples, Italy, are, like the city, expressions of the spiritual embedded in the profane.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman observes that portraits of patriarchs and prophets painted by Jusepe de Ribera in church of Certosa di San Martino in Naples, Italy, are like city itself, expressions of the spiritual embedded in the profane.
lead_paragraph: Ribera’s portraits, hidden up high and in the darkness of a church in Naples, Italy, are, like the city, expressions of the spiritual embedded in the profane.

headline.seo: Jusepe de Ribera’s Portraits at the Certosa di San Martino
headline.main: Church Portraits Speak to the Earthly World
headline.print_headline: Church Portraits Speak to the Earthly World
